messages.message: Useful feedback from a prospect on a call just now --- they tried Build but gave up because results were not as good quality as Converse -- so have proceeded with only Converse API

@Lee is a ticket already open for this in Jira?

@hannah @Bastiane this is what we briefly discussed in SF a few weeks ago. Customers expect a "behave like converse" option in build

The ‘Reasoning’ prompts are supposed to behave just like Converse. Was that what the client tried?

We’ve noticed differences in internal testing for table extraction and  investigating why the pipeline is behaving differently. cc: @lydia @Rakesh
It’d be helpful to have more details about their prompts / use cases. Are they looking to extract specific information? If not, they should use reasoning which returns the same results as Converse

I think there are 2 things going on

1. Anecdotally, Reasoning mode does not behave the same way as Converse right now
2. Customers are repeatedly tripping up on this, so if Reasoning does actually behave the same as converse, but customers are repeatedly having to reach out to us say it feels like build doesn't work as well as converse, and we have to give them guidance to use reasoning... then there is something we need to fix in our UX

This is exactly why we wanted more details on their use cases. So that we can provide more guidance on when they should use Reasoning vs Extraction. We also don't want users to use Reasoning when they want to extract, which generates verbose answers, another frequently reported issue. cc @melissa.amos @Natasha for more user guidance. And fully agree on 1. @lydia did you get a chance to look into this?

For example...
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C0516UPPMT3/p1701781547552059?thread_ts=1701682917.867429&cid=C0516UPPMT3

I think right now, it's not clear enough to the user in the UX that "reasoning" = "converse-like answers"
